page.title: 02ST. ELFOD JUNIOR SCHOOL
page.content:
Named after a 6th Century Celtic Saint and otherwise known by its Welsh name Ysgol Elfod, the school moved to its present premises in Ffordd-y-Morfa in 1972 from the Church in Wales building
Pupils whose first language is English attend from 7 years to 11 years of age. There are ten full time teachers and a part-time teacher. At each of the 4 age ranges there are two classes of mixed ability and one Special Unit class for those with learning difficulties. Headteacher is Mr. W. P. Wood.
The school has a broad curriculum and a wide range of extra curricular activities embracing music, movement, sport etc. The school day is from 8.55 am to 3.15
